page.title: 05FARMING AROUND LONGSTANTON
page.content: Almost all our area is under cultivation. The farms are primarily arable, and are held at present by ten farmers. Some of the farms employ only one man: we estimate that the total manpower for the whole area does not exceed twenty. The farmer we interviewed at Home Farm is atypical for the area in that he has a dairy herd. Thus one third of his land is under grass. The remainder grows crops usual for the district: wheat, barley and sweetcorn. Like the other crop commonly grown here - oil-seed rape - this is destined for cattle-feed. One farm in our area - Noon Folly - is now used by the National Institute of Agricultural Botany. They are running trials of potatoes, brassicas and cereals, including the promising new wheat/rye cross, triticale.
